div.p: The City of Long Beach was first settled in 1784 as part of a massive Spanish land grant that was given to soldier Manuel Nieto. The land was passed down to prominent ranchers and developers who planned its development along the Pacific coastline (Long Beach Area Convention & Visitors Bureau, 2015). There was a huge boom in the real estate market as a result of the emergence of the Pacific Railroad and Santa Fe Railroad companies. Long Beach became incorporated as a city in 1888 (City of Long Beach, 2016). Like many other early suburbs of the 20th century, Long Beach symbolized the very best of the American Dream, mainly functioning as a site for the aspirations of the wholesome family, property ownership and healthy living (Nicolaides, 2). The open beaches served as the backdrop to many attractions, recreation, leisure and cultural celebrations. Emblematic of the times, Long Beach served as the backdrop for the first ever Miss Universe pageant in 1952 (The Ottowa Citizen, 1952).
